page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: Woodbridge USAF Base has two schools, an Elementary with 1000 pupils age range 5-12 years, and a High School of about 600 pupils aged 12-16. The all- American staff in both schools number over 100. There is one English co- ordinator for joint Anglo-American activities. The schools cater for the Woodbridge and Bentwaters Bases, and children from up to 30 miles travel daily in about 50 buses. The only libraries in the area are in these schools, the one in the High School having over 7000 volumes, also film strips and records. In addition there are educational cassettes, 3 video recorders and 2 computers for student use. The Art Dept curriculum includes cinematics and a speech and drama group. Local British children are bussed to schools at Hollesley, Butley and Woodbridge.
